content:
2. Nitro BT Stock Solution:
Dissolve nitro blue tetrazolium (Sigma N6876), 50 mg/ml of 70%
Can be stored in refrigerator, up to a
month.
3. BCIP Stock Solution:
5-bromo-4-chloro-3-indolyl phosphate, p-toluidine salt (Sigma
B8503), 50 mg/ml 
4. Reagent Buffer Solution:
100 mM Tris-HCl, pH 9.5, 100 mM NaCl, 5 mM MgCl2
1.211 gm Tris-HCl (100 mM)
0.584 gm NaCl (100 mm)
0.25 ml 2 stock soln. (5 mM)
100 ml distilled water
adjust pH to 9.5
5. Reaction Solution:
10 ml Reagent Buffer Solution
33 ul Nitro-BT Stock Soln. added first
and then add 33 ul BCIP Stock Soln.
Nature of the reaction:
According to McGadey (1970), the oxidation of indolyl substrates
by non-specific alkaline phosphatase results in the production of
indigo (blue colored) and dehydroindigo (colorless), with the
release of hydrogen which reduces the tetrazolium salt to
diformazan (blue colored). The major source of hydrogens is
probably from the formation of the dehydroindigo. Diformazan is
said to be insoluble in alcohols and when mounted in a
xylene-soluble resinous medium remains a permanent color. In my
own experience the blue diformazan color disappears slowly in
alcohols; either the product is soluble or the alcohols
provide slight reducing conditions. The technique as described
above is formulated from the ProtoB1ot procedure described by
Promega as part of'a method using conjugated alkaline phosphatase
antibodies in the staining of Western Blots.
References:
"ProtoBlot Western Blot Technical Manual," 1987. Promega, 2800 S.
Fish Hatchery Road, Madison, WI 53711-5305.
McGadey, J. 1970.
A tetrazolium method for non-specific alkaline phosphatase.
Histochem. 23: 180-184.
Blake, M.S., Johnson, K.H., Russell-Jones, G.J. and 
E.C. 1984.
A rapid, sensitive method for detection of alkaline phosphatase-
conjugated anti-antibody on Western blots.
Anal. Biochem. 136: 175-179.
